page.title: 14Colvend: Language
page.content:
Many of the place-names in this part of Galloway are probably derived from ancient Pictish Gaelic. In old maps the name Lochend appears instead of Colvend. In even earlier times (16th century Church records) the name is written Kowhen and that is how old people pronounce the word.
Solway Firth - the sea of the racing tides; Colvend or Kowhen -the back of a hill; Barcloy - hill overlooking the green pasture; Boreland - swampy moorland; Mote of Mark - meeting place on a hill point; Half Merk - low hill by a river; Auchen - fields,meadows (Auchensheen, Auchenskeoch,Auchenvhin).
